data.title: Are Facebook’s New Political Ad Rules Enough to Quiet the Furor?
data.text: Facebook is taking steps to ensure political advertisers are who they say they are. Will this stop the flow of misinformation during the 2020 election?

data.title: Mark Zuckerberg Sells Facebook Stock, But Don’t Panic Yet
data.text:
FB stock might face some volatility in the nearer term, but the company is too ingrained in our society to suffer indefinitely.
The post Mark Zuckerberg Sells Facebook Stock, But Don’t Panic Yet appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Facebook Antitrust Probe: What the Investigation Will Focus On
data.text:
A Facebook antitrust probe is in the works and it has several attorneys general targeting the social media company in an investigation.
The post Facebook Antitrust Probe: What the Investigation Will Focus On appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Fed's Powell Says Facebook's Libra Could Become Systemic Quickly
data.text: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell speaks in Zurich about Facebook Inc.'s proposed Libra stablecoin.

data.title: Facebook, Google didn't plan on being monopolies, but are now too powerful, tech investor says
data.text: "They've had an inexorable growth beyond anyone's original expectations and as a result, they've become too big and too pervasive in our whole lives," says Greycroft founder Alan Patricof

data.title: Facebook Now In Cross-Hairs Of State Antitrust Investigations
data.text:
Facebook is joining Alphabet's Google unit in the crosshairs of several state attorneys general who are investigating possible antitrust violations among Silicon Valley technology giants. 
The post Facebook Now In Cross-Hairs Of State Antitrust Investigations appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Facebook Stock Likely to Get Boost From FB’s Imitation of SNAP
data.text: A new app in development from Facebook could drive more engagement to its platform, boosting FB stock. That'll be big news for the owners of Facebook stock.

data.title: Big Tech companies like Facebook, Amazon to face antitrust probe by U.S. state attorneys general
data.text: A bipartisan group of state attorneys general will announce on Monday an investigation into large tech companies, like Facebook and Google, for potential violations of antitrust law, Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton's announced on Friday.

data.title: It's very early in antitrust probes into Big Tech, says antitrust expert
data.text: Steve Houk, former head of the New York Attorney General Antitrust bureau, joins "Squawk on the Street" to discuss how Microsoft's antitrust case from the 1990s applies to new antitrust probes into Big Tech.

data.title: New York To Investigate Facebook Over Possible Antitrust Violations
data.text: The joint probe with several other states will look at how the social media giant's market dominance affects user data, consumer choice and the price of ads.

data.title: New York AG leads multi-state antitrust probe into Facebook
data.text: Several US state attorneys general will investigate Facebook on whether the social network stifled competition and put users at risk, days after reports that Google would face an antitrust probe from a host of attorneys general. “I’m launching an investigation into Facebook to determine whether their actions endangered consumer data, reduced the quality of consumers’.

data.title: New York AG Confirms Antitrust Investigation Into Facebook, Google Is Reportedly Next
data.text: New York State Attorney General Letitia James said Friday that her office is commencing a multistate antitrust investigation into Facebook, Inc.

data.title: NY attorney general will lead antitrust investigation into Facebook
data.text: New York Attorney General Letitia James announced this morning that she’s leading an investigation into Facebook over antitrust issues — in other words, whether Facebook used its social media dominance to engage in anti-competitive behavior. In a statement, James said: Even the largest social media platform in the world must follow the law and respect […]

data.title: Facebook Faces Antitrust Investigation by State Attorneys General
data.text: Regulators in eight states and the District of Columbia are moving forward with an antitrust investigation into Facebook, New York’s attorney general said.

data.title: Facebook to face antitrust probe by state attorneys general
data.text: Several U.S. state attorneys general will investigate Facebook Inc  on whether the social network stifled competition and put users at risk, days after reports that Google would face an antitrust probe from a host of attorneys general.

data.title: Can Facebook Dating Push FB Stock Higher?
data.text: The social media giant's dating venture could prove to be a turning point for the stock.

data.title: 3 Ways Facebook Is (Intentionally) Throttling Its Own Growth
data.text: The world’s top social network hits the brakes on some initiatives to reduce the chance of future scandals.

data.title: US states to launch antitrust and privacy inquiries into Facebook and Google
data.text: New York state attorney general said bipartisan coalition investigating if Facebook stifled competition and put users at risk.

data.title: Facebook hit by antitrust probe from multiple states
data.text: Nine state attorney generals are coming together to investigate Facebook's dominance.

data.title: Facebook faces antitrust probe from state attorneys general
data.text: A bipartisan coalition led by New York state attorney general (AG) is launching an investigation into Facebook Inc  to determine whether the company's actions endangered consumer data and increased advertising costs, New York AG Letitia James said on Friday.

data.title: New York attorney general is investigating Facebook for possible antitrust violations
data.text: Attorneys general of Colorado, Florida, Iowa, Nebraska, North Carolina, Ohio, Tennessee, and the District of Columbia will join the probe.

data.title: State AGs to launch separate Facebook, Google probes: WSJ
data.text: State attorneys general are formally launching separate antitrust probes into Facebook Inc.
